bibl.title: William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham v. David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell. Bond
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Justice Court of Mount Vernon Precinct County of Skagit, Territory of Washington

body.p: In the Justice Court before John T. Mason, one of the Justices of the peace in and for Mount Vernon Precinct, County of Skagit, Territory of Washington.
Territory of Washigton, Plaintiff, No...... vs. David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell, BOND. Defendants

KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that we, William W. Tinkham, as principal and Harrison Clothier as sureties, are held and firmly bound unto the Territory of Washington, David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell and to each of them, in the sum of one hundrerd dollars, lawful money of the United States, to be paid to the said Territory of Washington, David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell, their executors, administrators or assigns, for which payment, well and truly to be made, we bind ourselves, our and each of our heirs, executors and administrators, jointly and severally, firmly by these presents. Sealed with our seals and dated this 16th day of September, 1887.

The condition of the above obligation is such that, whereas, the above-bounden William W. Tinkham, has appealed form a decision, in the above entitled cause in the above named court, rendered on September 2nd, 1887 to the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at La Connes, in Skagit County, Wash. Ter. Now, therefore, if the above-bounded William W. Tinkham shall well and truly pay, or cause to be paid, the amount of the said Judgement and all costs, and obey any order the said District may make therein, if the said appeal be withdrawn or dismissed; or pay the amount of any judgement and all costs that may be recovered against the said appellant in said District Court, and obey any order the said Court may make therein, then this obligation to be null
Signed and Seal in the Presence of,
No. 476 In Justice Court of Skagit Co. Wash. Ter.
Territory of Wash vs David E. Kimble
Bond Filed and approved Sep 17, 1887 John T. Mason Justice of the Peace
BURKE & HALLER, ATTORNEYS=AT=LAW, SEATTLE, WASH. TER
